name: Legate Cassian Varro
location: Whiterun - Dragonsreach War Room / Whiterun Gates (siege)
role: Puppet-master Legate; public face of Imperial authority in Whiterun during the siege

current_status.notes: Assigned to Whiterun command as the Empire's liaison to Jarl Balgruuf. Publicly loyal, privately ensuring the siege drags on.

aspects.high_concept: Immaculate Imperial Legate with a Thalmor Cipher in His Dispatch Case
aspects.trouble: The War Must Stay Undecisive — or My Masters Will Be Displeased
other_aspects: Flawless Imperial Diction and a Thalmor Accent He Never Quite Loses

stunts: Mask of Legality: Because Varro always acts within the letter of Imperial law, +2 to Deceive when his orders are questioned by Imperial personnel.
Spectacle of Authority: Once per session, Varro may stage a public execution or morale act that creates the scene aspect 'Fear and Compliance' with a free invoke.
Cipher Drop: Varro may pass or receive coded Thalmor instructions mid-scene without Notice rolls from bystanders; only a Superb (+5) Notice or Investigate roll detects the exchange.
Puppet Master's Patience: +2 to Will against attempts to rattle or intimidate him during interrogation or confrontation.

equipment.special: Encrypted Thalmor cipher fragment (discovery item for 'The Hand Behind the Banner'); Imperial commission papers

personality_notes.speaking_style: Clipped Imperial Latin cadences, unfailingly courteous, never raises his voice. Uses formal titles. Lets long pauses do the threatening.
motivations: Keep the civil war in Whiterun Hold protracted and costly for both sides
Maintain his cover as a loyal Legate long enough for Thalmor Phase 2 to advance
Advance personally within the Legion while serving Thalmor interests
Ensure Ulfric is never captured — a dead Ulfric ends the war too quickly
fears: The cipher fragment being decoded by the players
Legate Rikke or General Tullius requesting his reassignment before the siege is complete
The players choosing the Expose outcome and making his network public
A decisive Imperial victory that ends his usefulness
quirks: Straightens his cuffs before any difficult conversation
Refers to Ulfric only as 'the pretender' in company, never by name in private correspondence
Occasionally quotes Aldmeri maxims in a language he pretends not to speak
Volunteers for morale spectacle duties — executions, proclamations — with unsettling enthusiasm

relationships.Elenwen: Handler and superior; Varro reports to her indirectly via dead-drops
relationships.Legate Rikke: Parallel authority; Varro defers to her publicly and undermines her privately
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Nominally commands him; Varro ensures Balgruuf sees exactly what serves the Thalmor
relationships.General Tullius: Distant chain of command; Varro exploits Tullius's disinterest in politics
relationships.The Player: Potential threat if suspicious; potential asset if corruptible

discovery_path.stage_0_public: Players meet Varro at Whiterun gates or Dragonsreach War Room as the new Imperial liaison. He is impeccably professional.
discovery_path.stage_1_clue: A cipher fragment is found during or after a siege skirmish in Varro's personal dispatch case or a dead-drop location near the walls.
discovery_path.stage_2_quest: Cipher fragment decoded (Lore roll or Thieves Guild contact) unlocks hidden quest: 'The Hand Behind the Banner'.

stage_3_outcomes.expose: Shorter siege; Thalmor retaliation clock +2; Varro arrested or flees to Thalmor embassy
stage_3_outcomes.blackmail: Party gains resources immediately; Varro becomes a compromised asset, corruption spreads later
stage_3_outcomes.double_agent: Counterintelligence clock begins; Varro feeds false intelligence to Thalmor; secret routes opened

scene_triggers: Battle of Whiterun stage 0 intro sting (one-time)
gm_notes: Varro is the Act I revelation antagonist. He should feel completely normal and trustworthy for as long as the players don't dig. The cipher fragment is a passive discovery — place it in a container the players are likely to search organically (a locked chest during the siege, an intercepted courier, Varro's quarters if players sneak in). Do not force discovery; the quest is present and discoverable, not mandatory. If players never find it, Varro simply disappears after the siege with a vague reassignment order.

loot_if_exposed_or_defeated.special: Encrypted Thalmor dossier — names three other hold-level assets in Skyrim (long-term campaign hook)
loot_if_exposed_or_defeated.campaign_impact: Exposing Varro accelerates Thalmor Phase 2 retaliation clock by +2; shortens Battle of Whiterun by 1 stage

alternatives_to_combat.blackmail: Varro will negotiate if he believes the party can be bought or is pragmatic enough to deal
alternatives_to_combat.expose_publicly: Requires evidence (cipher + corroborating witness); triggers diplomatic crisis
alternatives_to_combat.double_agent: Requires Deceive or Rapport against his Superb (+5) Deceive; he must believe you are also corruptible
